Looking at the code history, the current logic has been there since "the beginning".

The code in question is here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/image_ops_impl.py#L827

Here's the existing code:

  variance = (math_ops.reduce_mean(math_ops.square(image)) -
              math_ops.square(image_mean))

Here's the proposed code:

  variance = (math_ops.reduce_mean(math_ops.square(image-image_mean))

I believe these compute the same logical value, but might have different properties wrt numerical stability.

@rmlarsen might have some thoughts here on why we'd prefer one over the other.

Looking at the code history, the current logic has been there since "the beginning".

The code in question is here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/image_ops_impl.py#L827

Here's the existing code:
```
  variance = (math_ops.reduce_mean(math_ops.square(image)) -
              math_ops.square(image_mean))
```

Here's the proposed code:
```
  variance = (math_ops.reduce_mean(math_ops.square(image-image_mean))
```

I believe these compute the same logical value, but might have different properties wrt numerical stability.

@rmlarsen might have some thoughts here on why we'd prefer one over the other.
